intro: Varronia paucidentata var. valenzuelensis, commonly known as the Valenzuelan varrho, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in humid, lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
